title: Congruence of a series of points

blocks.name: ccgrg
blocks.content: Declare the constant for the congruence between shapes relation.
blocks.origin: const class ccgrg { cgrG }

blocks.name: diff.ccgrg.s
diff.ccgrg.c
diff.ccgrg.w
df-cgrg
blocks.content: Define the relation of congruence between shapes. Definition 4.4 of [Schwabhauser] p. 35. A "shape" is a finite sequence of points, and a triangle can be represented as a shape with three points. Two shapes are congruent if all corresponding segments between all corresponding points are congruent. Many systems of geometry define triangle congruence as requiring both segment congruence and angle congruence. Such systems, such as Hilbert's axiomatic system, typically have a primitive notion of angle congruence in addition to segment congruence. Here, angle congruence is instead a derived notion, defined later in ~ df-cgra and expanded in ~ iscgra . This does not mean our system is weaker; ~ dfcgrg2 proves that these two definitions are equivalent, and using the Tarski definition instead (given in [Schwabhauser] p. 35) is simpler. Once two triangles are proven congruent as defined here, you can use various theorems to prove that corresponding parts of congruent triangles are congruent (CPCTC). For example, see ~ cgr3simp1 , ~ cgr3simp2 , ~ cgr3simp3 , ~ cgrcgra , and permutation laws such as ~ cgr3swap12 and ~ dfcgrg2 . Ideally, we would define this for functions of any set, but we will use words (see ~ df-word ) in most cases. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cgrg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(ccgrg, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), co(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cpm, cr)), wcel(cv(s2), co(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cpm, cr))), wa(wceq(cdm(cv(s1)), cdm(cv(s2))), wral(s3, cdm(cv(s1)), wral(s4, cdm(cv(s1)), wceq(co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cfv(cds, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s4))), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cds, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}

axiom df-cgrg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ cgrG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s1, s2 > |((s1 ‚àà((Base ` s0)[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù)‚àß s2 ‚àà((Base ` s0)[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù))‚àß(dom(s1)= dom(s2)‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà dom(s1), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà dom(s1),((s1 ` s3)[(dist ` s0)](s1 ` s4))=((s2 ` s3)[(dist ` s0)](s2 ` s4))))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.content: The property for two sequences ` A ` and ` B ` of points to be congruent. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)

} = {
  3bitr4rd(w0, c0[c1]c2, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1)))), (dom(c0)= dom(c2)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1))))), ((c0 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù)‚àß c2 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù))‚àß(dom(c0)= dom(c2)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1)))))))
  biantrurd(w0, (dom(c0)= dom(c2)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1))))), (c0 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù)‚àß c2 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù)))

  syl2anc(w0, c0 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù), (c0 : c7 ‚Üí c4), c7 ‚äÜ ‚Ñù)
  mpanl12(((c0 : c7 ‚Üí c4)‚àß c7 ‚äÜ ‚Ñù), c0 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù), c4 ‚àà ùïå, ‚Ñù ‚àà ùïå)

  syl2anc(w0, c2 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù), (c2 : c7 ‚Üí c4), c7 ‚äÜ ‚Ñù)

  biantrurd(w0, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1)))), dom(c0)= dom(c2))
  eqtr4d(dom(c0), dom(c2), c7, w0)
  fdmd(c0, c7, c4, w0)
  fdmd(c2, c7, c4, w0)
  syl(w0, (c0[c1]c2 ‚Üî((c0 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù)‚àß c2 ‚àà(c4[p‚Ü¶]‚Ñù))‚àß(dom(c0)= dom(c2)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà dom(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà dom(c0),((c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1))=((c2 ` s0)[c3](c2 ` s1))))))), c5 ‚àà c6)

blocks.name: iscgrglt
blocks.content: The property for two sequences ` A ` and ` B ` of points to be congruent, where the congruence is only required for indices verifying a less-than relation. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 7-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: trgcgrg
blocks.content: The property for two triangles to be congruent to each other. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)

thm trgcgr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c9, c1), co(c4, c9, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c1, c9, c2), co(c5, c9, c6)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c2, c9, c0), co(c6, c9, c4)))

  ‚ä£ c7 =(Base ` c8)

} = {

blocks.name: tgcgrxfr
blocks.content: A line segment can be divided at the same place as a congruent line segment is divided. Theorem 4.5 of [Schwabhauser] p. 35. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 9-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: cgr3id
blocks.content: Reflexivity law for three-place congruence. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 28-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm cgr3id(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), c3, cs3(c0, c1, c2)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cds, c5))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(citv, c5))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ccgrg, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cstrkg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c4))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), c3, cs3(c0, c1, c2))), wceq(c7, cfv(citv, c5)))
  trgcgr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c0, c1, c2, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  eqidd(co(c0, c6, c1), w0)
  eqidd(co(c1, c6, c2), w0)
  eqidd(co(c2, c6, c0), w0)
}

  ‚ä£ c3 =(cgrG ` c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà TarskiG)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c4)

  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c4)
} = {

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí <" c0 . c1 . c2 ">[c3]<" c4 . c5 . c6 ">)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(Base ` c8)
  ‚ä£ c9 =(dist ` c8)
  ‚ä£ c10 =(Itv ` c8)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(cgrG ` c8)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c8 ‚àà TarskiG)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c11 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c12 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c13 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí <" c0 . c1 . c2 ">[c3]<" c11 . c12 . c13 ">)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c6 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí <" c11 . c12 . c13 ">[c3]<" c4 . c5 . c6 ">)
} = {
  trgcgr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, c9, w0)
  eqtrd((c0[c9]c1), (c4[c9]c5), (c11[c9]c12), w0)
  cgr3simp1(c0, c9, c1, c11, c12, c7, c8, c10, c3, c2, c13, w0)
  cgr3simp1(c11, c9, c12, c4, c5, c7, c8, c10, c3, c13, c6, w0)
  eqtrd((c1[c9]c2), (c5[c9]c6), (c12[c9]c13), w0)
  cgr3simp2(c1, c9, c2, c12, c13, c7, c8, c10, c3, c0, c11, w0)
  cgr3simp2(c12, c9, c13, c5, c6, c7, c8, c10, c3, c11, c4, w0)
  eqtrd((c2[c9]c0), (c6[c9]c4), (c13[c9]c11), w0)
  cgr3simp3(c2, c9, c0, c13, c11, c7, c8, c10, c3, c1, c12, w0)
  cgr3simp3(c13, c9, c11, c6, c4, c7, c8, c10, c3, c12, c5, w0)

blocks.name: tgbtwnxfr
blocks.content: A condition for extending betweenness to a new set of points based on congruence with another set of points. Theorem 4.6 of [Schwabhauser] p. 36. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm tgbtwnxfr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cds, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(citv, c5))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(ccgrg, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cstrkg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c10, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, c0, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, co(c8, c2, c10)))
} = {
  r19.29a(hs0, c4, w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))))
  eqeltrrd(c0, co(c1, c2, c3), cv(hs0), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  axtgcgrid(cv(hs0), c0, c4, c5, c6, c2, cv(hs0), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  tgifscgr(cv(hs0), c6, c0, cv(hs0), cv(hs0), c4, c5, c2, c1, c3, c1, c3, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  eqidd(co(c1, c6, c3), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  eqidd(co(cv(hs0), c6, c3), wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  cgr3simp1(c1, c6, c0, c1, cv(hs0), c4, c5, c2, c7, c3, c3, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  tgcgrcomlr(c3, c6, c0, c3, cv(hs0), c4, c5, c2, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  cgr3simp2(c0, c6, c3, cv(hs0), c3, c4, c5, c2, c7, c1, c1, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  trgcgrcom(c1, c0, c3, c7, c1, cv(hs0), c3, c4, c5, c6, c2, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  cgr3tr(c1, cv(hs0), c3, c7, c1, c0, c3, c4, c5, c6, c2, c8, c9, c10, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  trgcgrcom(c1, cv(hs0), c3, c7, c8, c9, c10, c4, c5, c6, c2, wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c5, cstrkg))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c8, c4))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c9, c4))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c10, c4))

  simprr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c1, c4))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c0, c4))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c3, c4))
  ad2antrr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3))), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, c0, c3)))
  simprl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, c2, c3)), wbr(cs3(c8, c9, c10), c7, cs3(c1, cv(hs0), c3)))
  tgcgrxfr(hs0, c4, c1, c2, c3, c8, c9, c10, c7, c5, c6, w0)
  tgcgrcomlr(c8, c6, c10, c1, c3, c4, c5, c2, w0)
  cgr3simp3(c10, c6, c8, c3, c1, c4, c5, c2, c7, c9, c0, w0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c8)
  diff.hs0.c(c9)
  diff.hs0.c(c10)
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.hs0.c(c6)

blocks.name: tgcgr4
blocks.content: Two quadrilaterals to be congruent to each other if one triangle formed by their vertices is, and the additional points are equidistant too. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 8-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm tgcgr4(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, class c12, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), c4, cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8)), wa(wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), c4, cs3(c5, c6, c7)), w3a(wceq(co(c0, c9, c3), co(c5, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c1, c9, c3), co(c6, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c2, c9, c3), co(c7, c9, c8))))))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cbs, c11))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(cds, c11))
  -| wceq(c12, cfv(citv, c11))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ccgrg, c11))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c11, cstrkg))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c10))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, c10))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wbr(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), c4, cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8)), wa(wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), c4, cs3(c5, c6, c7)), w3a(wceq(co(c0, c9, c3), co(c5, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c1, c9, c3), co(c6, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c2, c9, c3), co(c7, c9, c8)))))), wceq(c12, cfv(citv, c11)))
  3bitrd(w0, wbr(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), c4, cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8)), wa(wbr(cs3(c0, c1, c2), c4, cs3(c5, c6, c7)), w3a(wceq(co(c0, c9, c3), co(c5, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c1, c9, c3), co(c6, c9, c8)), wceq(co(c2, c9, c3), co(c7, c9, c8)))), wral(hs0, cdm(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3)), wral(hs1, cdm(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3)), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, cv(hs1)), wceq(co(cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), cv(hs1))))))), wral(hs0, co(nat0, cfzo, nat3), wa(wral(hs1, co(nat0, cfzo, nat3), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, cv(hs1)), wceq(co(cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), cv(hs1)))))), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), clt, nat3), wceq(co(cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), nat3)), co(cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), cv(hs0)), c9, cfv(cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), nat3)))))))
  iscgrglt(hs0, hs1, cs4(c0, c1, c2, c3), c4, cs4(c5, c6, c7, c8), c9, c10, c11, co(nat0, cfzo, nat4), w0)
  a1i(w0, wss(co(nat0, cfzo, nat4), cr))
  sstri(co(nat0, cfzo, nat4), cr, cn0)
